definition: (classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
to face a thousand pointing fingers with a cool scowl (citation from Lu Xun)/to treat with disdain/to defy
pinyin: heng2 mei2 leng3 dui4 qian1 fu1 zhi3

sentences.english: And David numbered the people that were with him, and set captains of thousands, and captains of hundreds over them.
sentences.chinese: 大卫数点跟随他的人，立千夫长，百夫长率领他们。

sentences.english: The last has become a general or a thousand of the total. Died in the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 他最终成为一名将军或或千夫长，战死在杀场。

sentences.english: And next to him was Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred and fourscore thousand.
sentences.chinese: 其次是，千夫长约哈难率领大能的勇士二十八万。

sentences.english: The very earth trembled as with the tramps of horses and murmur of angry men.
sentences.chinese: 连大地都震动了，宛若万马齐喑，千夫怒吼。

sentences.english: And the chief captain said, I got Roman rights for myself at a great price.
sentences.chinese: 千夫长说，我用许多银子，才入了罗马的民籍。

sentences.english: When the rioters saw the commander and his soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.
sentences.chinese: 他们见了千夫长和兵丁，就止住不打保罗。

sentences.english: And David consulted with the captains of thousands and hundreds， and with every leader.
sentences.chinese: 大卫与千夫长，百夫长，就是一切首领商议。

sentences.english: The very earth trembled as with the tramp of horses and murmur of angry men.
sentences.chinese: 连大地都震动了，仿佛万马奔腾，千夫怒吼。

definition: (literary) to put down one's burden/to rest/to stay (at an inn etc)
to roll up one's sleeves for action
to peel with a knife/old variant of 戮[lu4]
